description: Gets aggregated values (for example, average, minimum, and maximum) for one or more asset properties. For more information, see Querying aggregates in the IoT SiteWise User Guide.

parameters.name: entries
parameters.description: The list of asset property aggregate entries for the batch get request. You can specify up to 16 entries per request. (dict) --- Contains information for an asset property aggregate entry that is associated with the BatchGetAssetPropertyAggregates API. To identify an asset property, you must specify one of the following: The assetId and propertyId of an asset property. A propertyAlias, which is a data stream alias (for example, /company/windfarm/3/turbine/7/temperature). To define an asset property's alias, see UpdateAssetProperty. The ID of the entry. assetId (string) --- The ID of the asset in which the asset property was created. propertyId (string) --- The ID of the asset property, in UUID format. propertyAlias (string) --- The alias that identifies the property, such as an OPC-UA server data stream path (for example, /company/windfarm/3/turbine/7/temperature). For more information, see Mapping industrial data streams to asset properties in the IoT SiteWise User Guide. The data aggregating function. (string) --- The time interval over which to aggregate data. The exclusive start of the range from which to query historical data, expressed in seconds in Unix epoch time. The inclusive end of the range from which to query historical data, expressed in seconds in Unix epoch time. qualities (list) --- The quality by which to filter asset data. (string) --- timeOrdering (string) --- The chronological sorting order of the requested information. Default: ASCENDING.

parameters.name: maxResults
parameters.description: The maximum number of results to return for each paginated request. A result set is returned in the two cases, whichever occurs first. The size of the result set is equal to 1 MB. The number of data points in the result set is equal to the value of maxResults. The maximum value of maxResults is 4000.

nested_items.name: errorEntries
nested_items.description: A list of the errors (if any) associated with the batch request. Each error entry contains the entryId of the entry that failed.

nested_items.name: errorCode
nested_items.description: The error code.

nested_items.name: errorMessage
nested_items.description: The associated error message.

nested_items.name: entryId
nested_items.description: The ID of the entry.

nested_items.name: successEntries
nested_items.description: A list of entries that were processed successfully by this batch request. Each success entry contains the entryId of the entry that succeeded and the latest query result.

nested_items.name: entryId
nested_items.description: The ID of the entry.

nested_items.name: aggregatedValues
nested_items.description: The requested aggregated asset property values (for example, average, minimum, and maximum).

nested_items.name: timestamp
nested_items.description: The date the aggregating computations occurred, in Unix epoch time.

nested_items.name: quality
nested_items.description: The quality of the aggregated data.

nested_items.name: average
nested_items.description: The average (mean) value of the time series over a time interval window.

nested_items.name: count
nested_items.description: The count of data points in the time series over a time interval window.

nested_items.name: maximum
nested_items.description: The maximum value of the time series over a time interval window.

nested_items.name: minimum
nested_items.description: The minimum value of the time series over a time interval window.

nested_items.name: sum
nested_items.description: The sum of the time series over a time interval window.

nested_items.name: standardDeviation
nested_items.description: The standard deviation of the time series over a time interval window.

nested_items.name: skippedEntries
nested_items.description: A list of entries that were not processed by this batch request. because these entries had been completely processed by previous paginated requests. Each skipped entry contains the entryId of the entry that skipped.

nested_items.name: entryId
nested_items.description: The ID of the entry.

nested_items.name: completionStatus
nested_items.description: The completion status of each entry that is associated with the BatchGetAssetPropertyAggregates API.

nested_items.name: errorInfo
nested_items.description: The error information, such as the error code and the timestamp.

nested_items.name: errorCode
nested_items.description: The error code.

nested_items.name: errorTimestamp
nested_items.description: The date the error occurred, in Unix epoch time.

nested_items.name: nextToken
nested_items.description: The token for the next set of results, or null if there are no additional results.
